item.title: Titan Quest 2: Every Class (Mastery) Explained
item.description:
Titan Quest 2 doesn't have a traditional class system that you choose when you first make your character. During the prologue of the game, you get to choose which two Masteries you want to select, which will determine your class for the rest of the game.

There is a lot of flexibility in how you build your character after this decision, but the Masteries you choose are the most important decisions you'll make in the game. There are four Masteries to choose from, here are the highlights of each one to help you plan your perfect build.

Every Mastery in Titan Quest 2

There are four Masteries in the game at the time this article is being written, and the class your character becomes is determined by the two Masteries you choose . Your class name overall doesn't have much meaning behind it, as your Masteries determine everything. You'll have access to both of the skill trees for the Masteries you chose, and from there, you can upgrade them in any order you want to build your character. The four available Masteries are:

Mastery

Highlights

Earth

Gets access to fire and earth spells. Fire spells have a chance of igniting enemies for damage over time, while earth spells can either slow or stun enemies. A lot of spells in this mastery are great for dealing with groups.

Rogue

Move quickly around the battlefield, dealing large amounts of damage to individual enemies. A lot of skills also deal with various status effects, helping you debuff and further take down enemies outside of just attacking.

Storm

Gets access to ice and lightning spells. These are also great for dealing with groups, and ice spells have a chance at briefly freezing enemies.

Warfare

Warfare has a heavy focus on straightforward melee combat, dealing large amounts of damage to individuals or groups. There are also a few ways to boost armor for the caster and their allies, making it harder to take this Mastery down in combat.

Every time you level up, you'll get Attribute Points, Active Points, and Passive Points. You can choose to upgrade your various skill trees however you want, and the buffs across Masteries will boost the skills of the other Mastery you chose as long as the keywords match. As you progress the main story and continue to level up, you'll get Divinity Points which can be applied to one of your Masteries to later unlock Active and Passive skills higher up on the tree.

You also have a Core Skill tree to upgrade your basic attack, dodge, and barrier.

How to Respec in Titan Quest 2

When it comes to the actual Passive and Active skill points you invest into your various skill trees, you can respec these at any time. Simply open up your Masteries page in your menu and click on the "Respec Mode" button in the bottom right of the screen . From here, you can add or subtract your skill points however you see fit, though every point moved will cost Gold to do so, with the final price being determined by how many points you move where.

Can you Change Masteries in Titan Quest 2?

At the time of writing, there is no known way to change your Masteries after choosing them. In the first Titan Quest , you're decisions were set in stone, though also like that game, you have multiple character slots that you can use to try out different Mastery combinations without losing the progress of your original character.

item.title: Best Games For Living A Fantasy Life
item.description:
Summary

  • Sun Haven offers unique races and customizations for a vivid fantasy experience.
  • Enshrouded challenges survival in a blight-ridden world with engaging combat and multiplayer options.
  • Palia provides a laid-back and cozy experience with community interactions, romances, and various activities.

One of the biggest joys with gaming is the escapism it offers, allowing players to travel to a different world that is unlike the one they live in. Many role-playing games are perfect for this, as players are transported to a fantasy world, with many giving them the freedom to do whatever they wish as they go on their adventures.

Gamers who are looking for a new fantasy life for themselves should look no further than these particular titles. They are easily among the best games for living a fantasy life , not only due to the game itself being rated highly on sites such as OpenCritic, but also due to them consisting of an interesting fantasy world that the player can happily get lost in without even continuing the main story.

Sun Haven

A Pretty Pixel Fantasy Life

Sun Haven
7.5 /10
Released
March 11, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

With a variety of cozy games that are perfect for a player looking to start their own fantasy life, Sun Haven is arguably one of the greatest options. The game already starts off as any fantasy player's dream when they are asked to choose a race to play from multiple options, such as Elves, Naga, Demons, and so much more, followed by them fully customizing their character.

While players build up their farm, they unlock all sorts of magical spells that make the daily tasks of a farmer far easier, with the rain cloud spell being arguably one of the most loved of all. With multiple towns to visit in Sun Haven , there is plenty to discover outside its interesting story.

Enshrouded

Survive And Thrive In A Lost Kingdom

Enshrouded
7.7 /10
Released
January 24, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Keen Games
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Even with the game still currently in early access, Enshrouded has proven itself to have great potential for players looking to live a fantasy life. Those who are looking for a bit of a challenge with their life should consider games like Enshrouded , which test a player's survival skills in a blight-ridden world as the last of a dying race of people.

Enshrouded is a survival game that has something for all players. With enchanting combat for intense battles or simply staying at base building magnificent structures, players are free to live the way they want. On top of that, Enshrouded can also be enjoyed by up to 15 other people on a server.

Palia

An MMO Fantasy Life Sim Like No Other

Palia
7.9 /10
Released
August 10, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Alcohol Reference, Fantasy Violence, Mild Language, Mild Suggestive Themes, Use of Tobacco
Developer(s)
Singularity 6, Inc.
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC
Powered by

Palia is another incredible multiplayer fantasy life experience for gamers to enjoy. While Enshrouded has players exploring a survival world, Palia is far more of a laid-back title that sits well with those who enjoy cozy gaming. Like any good relaxing experience, Palia provides players with multiple activities to complete, from gathering resources to crafting furniture, fishing, or even creating their little farm.

The community is a large part of Palia , with many working together to collect some of the rarest materials, but the players aren't the only best thing. Even with many other players also interacting with the same NPCs, it's possible to start romances with a few of the characters in this fantasy world.

Fable 2

Classic Fantasy Fun In A Well-Developed World

Fable 2
8.0 /10
Released
October 21, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Language, Sexual Content, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Developer(s)
Lionhead Studios
Platform(s)
Xbox 360
Powered by

Classic RPG titles are still some of the best for those looking to live a fantasy life in games. Fable 2 is a game that many players remember fondly for its interesting world and how easy it was to get invested in. When the player wasn't trying to be a hero in Fable 2 , they could instead become a homeowner and own plenty of houses and shops across the world of Fable 2 .

Players could also work various jobs, such as at the pub or helping the blacksmith, but when they weren't trying to make money in this fantasy world, they could settle down with one of the NPCs instead. Almost any NPC is available to be romanced in Fable 2 , and the player can eventually start their own family as long as they have the space.

Rune Factory: Guardians Of Azuma

Build Villages And Help Gods

6 Images
6 Images
Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma
9.4 /10
Released
June 5, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Teen / Fantasy Violence, Language, Mild Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol
Developer(s)
Marvelous
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch 2, Nintendo Switch, PC
Powered by

The Rune Factory series is another great option for those looking to live a fantasy life, with the latest title, known as Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma , being one of the best to focus on living that life to the fullest. In between saving the gods and stopping all the runes being stripped from Azuma, the player is free to help build up the various villages named after the different seasons.

With a whole roster of NPCs to get to know, as players unlock more of the gods, the festivals will return, and eventually, the player can think about settling down in Azuma. Much of the end-game content of Guardians of Azuma cannot be unlocked until the player has married and had their first child, allowing them to finally experience one of the best games for living a fantasy life .

The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

Get Lost In All Sorts Of Side Quests And More

The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim Special Edition
8 /10
9.0 /10
Released
October 28, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol
Developer(s)
Bethesda Game Studios
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, PS5, Xbox One
Powered by

Unsurprisingly, The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim has found itself a deserving spot as one of the best games for living a fantasy life. In the open world of Skyrim , there is plenty more to do than simply the main story, with many players abandoning the chance of ever being the Dragonborn.

Instead, players can go on their own adventure across the world of Skyrim , finding new side quests to complete that see them joining various guilds. With the Special Edition of the title releasing in 2016, players have even been able to enjoy all the DLCs, with Hearthfire DLC being perfect for anyone looking to settle down by building their own home, getting married, and adopting kids.

Fantasy Life I: The Girl Who Steals Time

Perfect For Living A True Fantasy Life

14 Images
14 Images
Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time
9.2 /10
Released
May 21, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E For Everyone // Mild Fantays Violence
Developer(s)
Level 5
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Nintendo Switch 2
Powered by

After countless years, Fantasy Life returned with Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time . It's no surprise to see that this game is one of the best for living a fantasy life, with the latest title providing players with all the classic life options and more.

Besides grabbing a license for one of the many fighting, gathering, or crafting lives available, Fantasy Life i has hooked countless gamers with its Animal Crossing: New Horizons -style island decorating mechanic that players will eventually unlock. Here, players can use their lives to craft various pieces of furniture for the island, and they can even terraform it to suit their needs.

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Explore Forgotten Ruins And Great Cities In A Huge Open World

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
53
9.5 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Developer(s)
CD Projekt Red
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

By far, one of the greatest games for living a fantasy life has to be The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt . While the player may not be able to make their own custom character or start a family of their own like some other games mentioned, The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt makes up for this by providing players with a wondrous open world that truly feels alive.

With many morally gray situations, players can take a break from the stories to instead have a game or five of Gwent or go out into the wilderness to do some exploring of the various ruins and wreckage spread across the map.

item.title: Where to Take the Strange Jar (Talking Jar Quest) in Titan Quest 2
item.description:
Titan Quest 2 's Proti Island acts as a large prologue zone, letting players set the foundations for their character while also seeing the background for the story. While the island is fairly small, there is a bit of optional content that can be completed, though it's not easily tracked in a journal or by map markers.

One of the first bits of optional content players will find is the Strange Jar, which will ask for help from being attacked by nearby wolves. After picking up the Strange Jar, players will be tasked with taking it to the Altar of Hermes; here's where to find it.

What to do With the Strange Jar in Titan Quest 2

You'll get the Strange Jar in a small clearing near the Proti Village Outskirts waypoint. After picking up the Strange Jar, it can be found in the Quests tab of your Repository Inventory, so it won't take up any slots in your main inventory and keep you from picking up loot. From that waypoint, follow the path southwest until you reach a beach with a few crabs near a destroyed boat. Follow the beach to the north and head through the cave until you reach the next clearing.

All the spiders in the cave are only level 3 and won't pose any threat, no matter where you're at in the prologue.

In the second clearing of the cave, the Strange Jar will start talking again, and indicate you found the altar in the bottom left corner of the cave . Interact with the Altar to place the Strange Jar down and complete the quest. The Jar won't get any response from Hermes, but it will give you a reward for helping it out. Even as the Jar keeps talking, there's no benefit or reward for standing around and listening to it talk to Hermes aside from the potential lore implication that it's Hermes' brother in the Jar.

Rewards for Helping the Strange Jar in Titan Quest 2

The reward for this mini-quest is a random rare weapon. The exact reward is determined by your current build, determined by the Masteries you've chosen . While there's no guarantee it will be better than what you have, it will at least be worth considering for your current class. You'll also get a small sum of XP, 1,848, that can help you get another level in before trying to face the Gryphon.

item.title: Umamusume Pretty Derby - Satsuki Sho Race Guide
item.description:
In order to complete all the race trophies in Umamusume: Pretty Derby , you will need to get first place in every G1, G2, or G3 race possible. With each new trophy comes some free carats, the premium currency in the game, so you probably want every single one for yourself.

One of the many races you will need to run in Umamusume is the Satsuki Sho. It is a G1 race that takes place early in Classic year. If you need to know who can run this early-career race and who is best to win it, you can find all that information below.

The Satsuki Sho Race in Umamusume

The Satsuki Race takes place in second, or Classic , year in Early April . This race takes place at Nakayama Turf , meaning it is a Medium Turf race. Since it is a G1, you can get tons of fans from it as well as a pile of skill points. Below, you will find a list of all the horses that run the race already in their careers, ones that excel at this type of race, and who best to choose for it.

How to Build for the Satsuki Sho Race in Umamusume

If you want to win the Satsuki Sho, you are in luck. Since it is a Medium course pretty early in career mode, you can run it without having to tailor your stats to it too much. All you need to do is have some speed and a little stamina to keep you in first place, and you will need a little bit of Wit to make sure you can use the skills you have, including your Umamusume 's unique skill.

item.title: Best Open-World Games For Feeling Like The Chosen One,
item.description:
Open-world games offer players the opportunity to step into the shoes of a heroic protagonist, often equipped with supernatural capabilities or powers to help them conquer entire worlds over the course of a playthrough. But sometimes, the games go above and beyond and deliver an experience that really gives the player the sense that they were destined for greatness right from the start.

The concept of a chosen hero is the perfect fit for the open-world genre, as with so many people to save and enemies to slay, the player truly feels in control of their destiny within the narrative. Many games heavily lean into this idea, giving them plenty of power to elevate them above the rest of the people in the world, and by the end, they become a ruthless and unstoppable force.

inFAMOUS Second Son

Gifted Powers Beyond Comprehension

inFAMOUS Second Son
8 /10
8.4 /10
Released
March 21, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Blood, Drug Reference, Language, Sexual Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Sucker Punch
Platform(s)
PlayStation 4
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

inFAMOUS Second Son thrusts players into the role of a super-charged Delsin Rowe, a conduit with the ability to wield a variety of powers from different elements in the environment. Players start out with some powerful fire skills, but quickly unlock new ones that can be absorbed from other powerful characters in the world.

The game really feeds into the power fantasy of an unconventional superhero, giving players abilities like a giant leap into the air, which gives players a devastating blow that wipes everything from the screen. There's no major help from any other characters, and the player really is the sole hero in a world that's out to get them.

Biomutant

Shaping The Future Of The Entire World

BioMutant
5 /10
4.5 /10
Released
May 25, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Alcohol Reference, Blood, Crude Humor, Fantasy Violence, Use of Tobacco
Developer(s)
Experiment 101
Platform(s)
PS4, PC, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Switch
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

Biomutant casts the player as a mutated creature prophesied to shape the worlds future. Its unique blend of open-world exploration and customizable abilities places the player in a pivotal role within a fractured ecosystem, with the whole narrative centering on the players ability to influence tribal alliances and the outcome of a dying world.

The games dynamic world reacts vividly to player decisions, reinforcing the sensation of being the main character in a drawn-out story. The presence of a mythical Tree of Life and ancient threats positions the protagonist as an indispensable force in a landscape shaped by fate, and the players growing power and responsibility create a constant sense of rising importance throughout.

Immortals Fenyx Rising

Saving Literal Gods From A Titanic Threat

Immortals Fenyx Rising
Action RPG
Systems
Released
December 3, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
8 /10

ESRB
T for Teen: Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Ubisoft Quebec
Platform(s)
PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Stadia, Xbox One, PC, Switch
Powered by

Immortals Fenyx Rising embraces the mythological hero archetype by placing the player in the shoes of Fenyx, a demigod tasked with saving the Greek gods and the world from the looming Titan threat. The narrative and gameplay reinforce the players divine status through godly powers, epic challenges, and heroic quests, in a vibrant world filled with mythical creatures as well as some healthy doses of humor.

The design ensures the player feels their heroic influence in every corner of the open world. Challenges grow progressively more difficult, demanding skill and creativity that only a true hero could master. The constant interaction with gods and mythic beings underlines the player's elevated status and the world's dependence on their success, providing a compelling sense of destiny and chosen purpose.

The Legend Of Zelda: Tears Of The Kingdom

Fulfilling The Prophecy One Step At A Time

The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom
60
9.2 /10
Released
May 12, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
Rated E for Everyone 10+ for Fantasy Violence and Mild Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
Nintendo
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Switch 2
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Tears of the Kingdom lets players take on the role of the legendary hero, Link, destined to confront the darkness threatening Hyrule. The game's expansive world and intricate lore immerse the player in an ongoing prophecy where the fate of the kingdom hinges on their actions, and the open-ended exploration and evolving abilities emphasize Links growing mastery and status as a protector.

The world-building supports a profound connection to Links role as the chosen one through environmental storytelling and dynamic challenges that continue to push the player right until the credits roll. The player's progression is tightly interwoven with the restoration of Hyrule, reinforcing the weight of their mission and the epic scale of the journey.

Middle-Earth: Shadow Of War

Infused With The Power To Overthrow Sauron

Middle-Earth: Shadow of War
9 /10
8.7 /10
Released
October 10, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence
Developer(s)
Monolith
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Shadow of War centers on Talion, a ranger fused with the spirit of the elf lord Celebrimbor, granting him supernatural powers vital to overthrowing Saurons reign. This fusion marks the player as the linchpin in a world locked in an eternal struggle between good and evil, with many systems playing into that idea that are directly tied to the gameplay.

The narrative intertwines fate and power, making the player both a weapon and a leader destined to challenge the darkness, and each conquest and alliance solidifies the players role as a force to be reckoned with, reinforcing a deep sense of agency in a legendary conflict. The immersive mechanics and story converge to establish the player as an essential figure whose actions redefine the world, all while giving the player the tools they need to feel powerful and impactful.

Elden Ring

The Tarnished One Driven To Claim The Ring

6 Images
6 Images
Elden Ring
10 /10
68
9.1 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
From Software
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Elden Ring is a very distinctive open-world game that omits traditional quests and waypoints, but still delivers an experience where the player truly feels like an immensely powerful being in a world full of evil. Players begin with nothing and as a nobody, but it quickly becomes apparent that they are more than just a lowly adventurer, and they quickly blossom into a fully-fledged hero as a Tarnished who can mend the world, or bring it to ruin.

The power curve feels rewarding and just, and there is always a new challenge on the horizon for them to conquer and to bring them one step closer to fulfilling their destiny. With so many mountainous threats to take on, the sense of accomplishment gained after every triumph continues to feed into the idea of a single warrior taking on an entire kingdom.

Horizon Zero Dawn

Humanity's Last Hope Against All Powerful Machines

Horizon Zero Dawn
Adventure
RPG
Systems
Released
February 28, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen - Blood, Drug Reference, Language, Mild Sexual Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Guerrilla Games
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

In Horizon Zero Dawn , Aloy is the embodiment of a hero tied to her destiny. A young hunter with a mysterious past and a life tied to the salvation of a world overrun by machines, her story unfolds as a quest for truth and purpose, positioning Aloy as a unique savior with the knowledge and skills to challenge the various threats across the world.

The deep narrative and personal stakes reinforce the players feeling of singular importance in a vast, dangerous world, with every discovery and battle shaping Aloys legend. The player's growing command over technology and influence in tribal conflicts emphasize the transformative role Aloy occupies in this richly crafted universe, and by the end of the campaign, no machine is left standing.

The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

Become The Dragonborn

6 Images
6 Images
The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
9 /10
80
9.5 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol
Developer(s)
Bethesda Game Studios
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, Xbox 360, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Skyrim offers the player the mantle of the Dragonborn, a prophesied hero with the power to absorb dragon souls and prevent an apocalyptic event. This power is woven throughout the game's vast open world and narrative, making the player the undeniable focal point of the realms fate. The player isn't just the chosen one as a Dragonborn, but also as a leader of pretty much every faction they manage to stumble into.

The game's expansive world-building and lore center the player within a centuries-old prophecy, constantly underscoring their singular importance. Progression through dragon shouts and major quests mirrors the growth of the chosen one archetype, from unknown traveler to legendary hero, and the player's impact on Skyrims political and supernatural landscape affirms the role of a world-defining figure in an epic saga.
